redbone.health_care: Minimal shedding; short coat needs weekly brushing. Needs **high daily exercise** and mental stimulation. Their baying can be problematic in close quarters (apartments). Long, floppy ears need regular checks for infection. **Must always be leashed/fenced** (high prey/roaming drive).
redbone.size: Height: 53–69 cm (21–27 in); Weight: 20–32 kg (45–70 lb)
redbone.common_health_issues: Hip dysplasia, ear infections (otitis), running injuries (common for hunting dogs).

rhodesian_ridgeback.nature: Strong, loyal, and athletic African hound. Dignified and reserved with strangers, but affectionate and playful with family. High prey drive.
rhodesian_ridgeback.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet. Prone to **Bloat (GDV)**; feed multiple small meals daily and restrict exercise around mealtimes. Maintain a lean, athletic physique; weight gain will stress joints.
rhodesian_ridgeback.health_care: Minimal grooming; short coat needs **weekly brushing**. Needs a **moderate to high level of daily exercise** (long runs/play). Early and consistent socialization and firm, positive training are mandatory. Sensitive to anesthesia (sighthound heritage). **Spinal screening for Dermoid Sinus** is essential at birth.
rhodesian_ridgeback.size: Height: 61–69 cm (24–27 in); Weight: 32–38.5 kg (70–85 lb)
rhodesian_ridgeback.common_health_issues: Dermoid Sinus (congenital spinal defect), Bloat (GDV), Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Hypothyroidism, sighthound anesthesia sensitivity.

rottweiler.nature: Confident, loyal, and protective family guardian. Intelligent and easy to train, but requires a strong, experienced leader. High energy when young.
rottweiler.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. Deep-chested; predisposed to **Bloat (GDV)**—feed multiple small meals daily. **Highly prone to obesity**; strict portion and treat control is essential to protect joints.
rottweiler.health_care: Low grooming needs; weekly brushing of the short, coarse coat. Requires **daily exercise** (walking, swimming, nose work). Avoid high-impact activities on hard surfaces. **Frequent joint checks** (hips/elbows/CCL). Preventative gastropexy is often recommended for GDV risk.
rottweiler.size: Height: 56–69 cm (22–27 in); Weight: 36–61 kg (80–135 lb)
rottweiler.common_health_issues: Bloat (GDV), Osteosarcoma (bone cancer), Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Cranial Cruciate Ligament (CCL) rupture, Subaortic Stenosis (SAS—heart), Entropion.

saint_bernard.nature: Gentle, loving, and placid giant. Exceptionally patient and understanding with children. Instinctive friendliness offsets imposing size. Prone to heavy drooling and heat sensitivity.
saint_bernard.food_diet: Giant breed food. Food requirement can be low due to placid temperament. **Do not overfeed**; excess weight severely strains joints. Puppies need **controlled large-breed formula** to minimize growth rate. Feed measured portions twice daily.
saint_bernard.health_care: Heavy shedder; long/short double coat needs **regular brushing** (daily during shedding). Needs **minimal daily exercise** (short walk/play). **Frequent joint, heart, and eye checks** are essential. Prone to overheating.
saint_bernard.size: Height: 66–76 cm (26–30 in); Weight: 54–90 kg (120–200 lb)
saint_bernard.common_health_issues: Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Bloat (GDV), Osteosarcoma (bone cancer), various eye issues (Entropion, Ectropion), Dilated Cardiomyopathy (DCM).

saluki.origin: Fertile Crescent (Middle East)—one of the oldest breeds.
saluki.nature: Aloof, reserved, gentle, and quiet indoors. Noble and graceful. High prey drive (sighthound); enjoys sprints and high activity bursts.
saluki.food_diet: High-quality, high-protein diet to maintain lean, athletic physique. **Small appetite**; does not eat much for its size. Puppies need nutrient-rich food. Adults should be fed from a **raised bowl**.
saluki.health_care: Low grooming needs; short/feathered coat needs **weekly brushing**. Needs **long daily brisk walks and secure space for running/sprints**. Sighthound anesthesia sensitivity. Nails grow quickly and need regular trimming. Needs early socialization.
saluki.size: Height: 58–71 cm (23–28 in); Weight: 16–27 kg (35–60 lb)
saluki.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, Heart Disease (Dilated Cardiomyopathy/DCM), Hypothyroidism, sighthound anesthesia sensitivity, certain cancers.

samoyed.nature: Cheerful and fluffy with a famous 'Sammy smile'. Gentle, friendly, intelligent, and highly social. High energy and working drive. Prone to being vocal.
samoyed.food_diet: Digestible diet with **quality protein** for muscle and energy. **Omega-3 fatty acids** are important for skin and coat health. Feed two measured meals daily. Monitor weight closely as they are prone to joint issues.
samoyed.health_care: Very high grooming needs; thick double coat sheds heavily and needs **daily brushing** (several times a week minimally) to prevent matting. Needs **at least 2 hours of daily exercise** and mental stimulation. Thrives in cold weather. Needs protection from heat. **Daily tooth brushing** is recommended.
samoyed.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Hypothyroidism, Diabetes Mellitus, Samoyed Hereditary Glomerulopathy (SHG—kidney disease).

schipperke.nature: Small, bold watchdog ('Little Captain'). Highly intelligent, curious, and mischievous. Content to relax but prone to barking/exploring. Energetic for its size.
schipperke.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet. Feed two measured meals daily. Monitor portion sizes to prevent obesity.
schipperke.health_care: Moderate shedding. Undercoat doesn't mat easily; coat requires **brushing/combing once or twice a week** (more during shedding). Needs regular exercise and is suited for apartment life if exercised. **Regular dental care** is important.
schipperke.size: Height: 25–33 cm (10–13 in); Weight: 4.5–7 kg (10–16 lb)
schipperke.common_health_issues: Mucopolysaccharidosis Type IIIB (MPS IIIB/Sanfilippo syndrome—DNA test available), patellar luxation, epilepsy, hypothyroidism, Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease.

scotch_terrier.nature: Dignified, brave, and independent. Feisty, spirited, and bred for vermin control. Best suited as the only pet in a home without small children. Loyal to family.
scotch_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. Prone to **obesity**, which worsens joint issues; strictly monitor portions. Feed two meals daily.
scotch_terrier.health_care: Wiry double coat needs **weekly brushing**; requires **stripping or clipping twice a year**. Needs daily walks and frequent play sessions. High chase instinct; **must be leashed/fenced**. **Daily tooth brushing** is important (dental disease risk). Check for skin allergies (atopy).
scotch_terrier.common_health_issues: Craniomandibular Osteopathy ('Scottie Jaw'), Scottie Cramp (muscular disorder), various cancers (Transitional Cell Carcinoma/bladder cancer, Mast Cell Tumors), dental disease, patellar luxation, skin allergies (atopy).

scottish_deerhound.nature: Noble, gentle, and courteous. Large, courageous sighthound bred for hunting deer. Quiet indoors; not a good watchdog (rarely barks).
scottish_deerhound.food_diet: Requires a **large-breed diet**. Deep-chested; high risk for **Bloat (GDV)**; feed multiple small meals. Puppies need a controlled growth diet. Sighthound anesthesia sensitivity means lean body mass must be maintained.
scottish_deerhound.health_care: Rough, wiry coat needs **weekly brushing**. Shortest lifespan of the large hounds. Needs **daily vigorous exercise** in a large, securely fenced area (high prey/chase drive). **Frequent cardiac and bloat checks are critical**.
scottish_deerhound.size: Height: Males >= 76 cm (30 in), Females >= 71 cm (28 in); Weight: Males approx 45.5 kg (100 lb), Females approx 36.5 kg (80 lb)
scottish_deerhound.common_health_issues: Bloat (GDV), Dilated Cardiomyopathy (DCM), Osteosarcoma (bone cancer), sighthound anesthesia sensitivity, heart disease (Sick Sinus Syndrome).

sealyham_terrier.nature: Friendly, fearless, and lively. Loyal and affectionate, but needs firm training to manage terrier independence. Prone to food guarding if not corrected early.
sealyham_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate food. Prone to getting overweight, so watch calorie consumption. Feed two measured meals daily. Avoid foods with extra dye for show dogs (stains beards).
sealyham_terrier.health_care: Coat needs combing and **brushing every two or three days** (mats easily). Needs **hand stripping or clipping** regularly. Needs plenty of exercise in a safely enclosed area; avoid hot weather. Needs early socialization to prevent dog aggression. **Check eyes/ears regularly**.
sealyham_terrier.size: Height: approx 27 cm (approx 10.5 in); Weight: approx 10-11 kg (approx 23-24 lb)
sealyham_terrier.common_health_issues: Hereditary eye diseases (e.g., Progressive Retinal Atrophy), allergies, Retinal Dysplasia, lens luxation.

shetland_sheepdog.nature: Intelligent, affectionate, loyal, and highly trainable. Excellent herding dog. Cautious around strangers. High barking tendency (alert nature).
shetland_sheepdog.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet. Prone to obesity, so monitor food intake carefully. Needs a diet that supports coat health (omega-3s). Feed two measured meals daily.
shetland_sheepdog.health_care: Long double coat sheds heavily; requires **regular brushing** (daily is best) to prevent matting. Needs moderate exercise (walks and play) and high mental stimulation. Highly sensitive; training works best with positive reinforcement. **DNA testing for CEA and MDR1** is advised.
shetland_sheepdog.size: Height: 33–41 cm (13–16 in); Weight: 6–12 kg (14–27 lb)
shetland_sheepdog.common_health_issues: Collie Eye Anomaly (CEA), Hip Dysplasia, MDR1 drug sensitivity, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Hypothyroidism, Dermatomyositis (skin/muscle disease).

shih_tzu.nature: Affectionate lapdog with playful charm. Bred for companionship. Can be stubborn but loves people. Pronounced jaw (underbite common).
shih_tzu.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. **Prone to obesity**. Strict portion control is necessary. May need food to manage allergies. Food should be easy to pick up due to the brachycephalic jaw.
shih_tzu.health_care: Luxurious coat needs **daily brushing** and professional grooming to prevent tangles and skin issues. **Brachycephalic**; extreme care to avoid overheating. Needs daily short walks/play. **Daily tooth brushing** is vital. Prone to severe eye issues (shallow sockets). Clean eye corners regularly.
shih_tzu.size: Height: 20–28 cm (8–11 in); Weight: 4–7.25 kg (9–16 lb)
shih_tzu.common_health_issues: Brachycephalic Airway Syndrome (BOAS), eye conditions (cataracts, glaucoma, KCS/dry eye, Proptosis), dental disease, patellar luxation, Portosystemic Shunt (PSS—liver), Intervertebral Disc Disease (IVDD), Von Willebrand disease (vWD).

siberian_husky.nature: Friendly, energetic, and highly independent. Bred as a sled dog (needs to run). Known for vocalizations (howls, yelps) rather than barking. Stubborn and prone to escaping/roaming.
siberian_husky.food_diet: High-quality diet appropriate for high energy. Bred to run on minimal food, so they regulate metabolism efficiently. Prone to **zinc deficiency** (Zinc-Responsive Dermatosis). Feed two measured meals daily. Strict weight monitoring (obesity is a risk if under-exercised).
siberian_husky.health_care: Thick double coat sheds heavily bi-annually; needs **regular brushing**. Requires **significant daily vigorous exercise** (long runs, pulling activities). **Secure fencing (high and secure)** is mandatory. Needs protection from heat. DNA testing for vWD and eye issues is advised.
siberian_husky.size: Height: 51–60 cm (20–23.5 in); Weight: 16–27 kg (35–60 lb)
siberian_husky.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, various eye diseases (cataracts, corneal dystrophy, PRA), Hypothyroidism, Epilepsy, Follicular Dysplasia (hair loss), Von Willebrand disease (vWD), Zinc-Responsive Dermatosis.

silky_terrier.nature: Elegant, lively, and affectionate toy terrier. More a terrier than a lapdog (needs more exercise than many toy breeds). High prey drive.
silky_terrier.food_diet: High-quality food formulated for **small or toy breeds**. Feed two measured meals daily. Limit high-fat treats to prevent weight gain.
silky_terrier.health_care: Coat needs **brushing at least twice a week** with a pin brush/comb to prevent tangles/mats. Needs **daily exercise** (walks, fetch). Requires a leash outside due to a strong prey drive. **Regular tooth brushing** is important. **Screen for patellar luxation**.
silky_terrier.size: Height: 23–25 cm (9–10 in); Weight: approx 4.5 kg (approx 10 lb)
silky_terrier.common_health_issues: Patellar luxation, Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease (LCPD), tracheal collapse, dental disease, eye diseases (cataracts, PRA).

soft-coated_wheaten_terrier.nature: Happy, steady, confident, and energetic. Loves to be included in activities. Independent with a mischievous streak. Willing to please.
soft-coated_wheaten_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet fed **at least twice daily**. Weight monitoring is crucial. Needs motivation (food/toys) during training due to independence.
soft-coated_wheaten_terrier.health_care: Non-shedding/low-shedding, but soft coat needs **regular brushing** (daily is recommended) to prevent matting. Needs a minimum of **an hour per day of walking** plus free running/engaging activities (scent work) to prevent destructive behavior. Prone to protein-losing diseases.
soft-coated_wheaten_terrier.size: Height: 43–51 cm (17–20 in); Weight: 14–18 kg (30–40 lb)
soft-coated_wheaten_terrier.common_health_issues: Protein-Losing Enteropathy (PLE—gastrointestinal), Protein-Losing Nephropathy (PLN—kidney), Addison's Disease, Renal Dysplasia (kidney), Hip Dysplasia, Atopy (skin allergies).

staffordshire_bullterrier.nature: Muscular, yet highly affectionate, loyal, and reliable companion. Energetic and eager to please. Often called a 'Nanny Dog' due to gentleness with children. Can be abrasive with strange dogs.
staffordshire_bullterrier.food_diet: High-quality, protein-rich diet (due to muscle mass). Prone to obesity; avoid fillers and monitor weight strictly. Omega-3 fatty acids may support dermatological health (prone to skin allergies). Feed two meals daily.
staffordshire_bullterrier.health_care: Short, smooth coat is low-maintenance; brush occasionally. Prone to **overheating**; avoid strenuous activity in hot weather. Needs **daily vigorous play** and exercise. Requires **early socialization** to prevent dog-aggression. Check ears/teeth/nails regularly. Genetic testing for JHC and L-2-HGA is highly recommended.
staffordshire_bullterrier.size: Height: 35–40 cm (14–16 in); Weight: 11–17 kg (24–38 lb)
staffordshire_bullterrier.common_health_issues: Juvenile Hereditary Cataracts (JHC—genetic testing advised), L-2-Hydroxyglutaric Aciduria (L-2-HGA—neurological), skin allergies (atopy), hip and elbow dysplasia, patellar luxation, Degenerative Myelopathy (DM).

standard_poodle.nature: Intelligent, athletic, proud, and sensitive. Highly trainable and good with children/pets. Needs a lot of mental and physical stimulation.
standard_poodle.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet. Deep-chested; risk of **Bloat (GDV)**. Feed two or more measured meals daily. Avoid overfeeding to prevent joint strain. Nutritional needs are similar to other Poodle sizes, but portions are larger.
standard_poodle.health_care: Non-shedding, curly coat needs **daily brushing** to prevent mats or **professional grooming every 4–6 weeks**. Requires **high daily exercise** (long runs, swimming, retrieving). Needs moderate to cool climate (thick coat). Check for signs of skin/ear allergies.
standard_poodle.size: Height: >= 38 cm (>= 15 in, typically 55-62 cm); Weight: 18–32 kg (40–70 lb)
standard_poodle.common_health_issues: Bloat (GDV), Hip Dysplasia, Addison's disease (adrenal), Sebaceous Adenitis (skin), Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Epilepsy, Atrial Septal Defects (ASD—heart).

standard_schnauzer.nature: The original Schnauzer; perfect balance of independence/protectiveness (working heritage) and playful spirit. Intelligent, loyal, and a natural, excellent watchdog. Wary of strangers.
standard_schnauzer.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet. Prone to weight gain; monitor calories. Deep-chested; feed multiple, smaller meals daily (bloat prevention). Joint supplements may be beneficial.
standard_schnauzer.health_care: High maintenance grooming. Wiry double coat needs **frequent brushing** and **regular stripping/clipping**. Needs daily wiping of the beard (food traps). Requires **lots of physical and mental exercise** (training, dog sports). Needs a confident, experienced owner. **Test for hip/eye issues**.
standard_schnauzer.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, hereditary eye defects (cataracts, Progressive Retinal Atrophy), follicular dysplasia (skin/coat), urinary stones.

sussex_spaniel.nature: Happy, adaptable, and laid-back, but can be stubborn and is a tenacious hunter outdoors. Retains a strong hunting focus. Loyal companion.
sussex_spaniel.food_diet: Balanced diet, fed **at least twice daily**. Prone to **Bloat (GDV)**; feed smaller, more frequent meals. Weight control is important. Prone to Hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) in puppies/young dogs.
sussex_spaniel.health_care: Medium-long coat needs **regular brushing/combing** (mats easily). Needs **2 hours or more of daily exercise** that includes a variety of terrain/swimming. Needs extensive training to manage stubbornness and hunting drive. Should not be over-exercised when young (slow-growing joints).
sussex_spaniel.size: Height: 38–41 cm (15–16 in); Weight: 18–23 kg (35–50 lb)
sussex_spaniel.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, Pulmonic Stenosis (heart), Intervertebral Disc Disease (IVDD), Pyruvate Kinase Deficiency (pdp1—metabolic disease; genetic test available), Entropion, ear infections, bloat (GDV).

tibetan_mastiff.nature: Powerful guardian with a calm, noble, and reserved temperament. Independent and protective. Prone to barking at night (guardian instinct). Slower to mature than other breeds.
tibetan_mastiff.food_diet: Giant breed food. Puppies need large-breed formula beyond the first year (slow maturation). **Not very food-driven**; may skip meals, eating only when truly hungry. Adults should be fed twice daily. Avoid overfeeding/excessive treats (weight gain strains joints).
tibetan_mastiff.health_care: Thick coat needs **regular brushing** (daily/weekly) to remove excess undercoat, especially during seasonal shedding. Needs moderate daily exercise (walking/play). Avoid overheating. **Check ears and eyes regularly** (prone to Entropion/Ectropion). Needs early, extensive socialization and confident handling.
tibetan_mastiff.size: Height: 61–72 cm (24–28 in); Weight: 32–68 kg (70–150 lb)
tibetan_mastiff.common_health_issues: Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Entropion/Ectropion (eyelid issues), Hypothyroidism, Canine Inherited Demyelinative Neuropathy (CIDN—neurological), Osteochondritis Dissecans (OCD).

tibetan_terrier.nature: Medium-sized, affectionate, and intelligent companion. Good watchdog (prone to barking). Highly adaptable but independent and stubborn streak. Can be reserved with strangers.
tibetan_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet fed **at least twice daily**. Weight monitoring is important for their sensitive joints. Diet may need adjustment for skin/digestive issues (prone to atopy).
tibetan_terrier.health_care: Long double coat needs **daily brushing** to prevent matting. Needs moderate daily exercise (walks/play) and mental stimulation. Screen for inherited eye/joint issues. Sensitive; responds best to positive reinforcement. **Check for skin allergies**.
tibetan_terrier.size: Height: 35–41 cm (14–16 in); Weight: 8–14 kg (18–30 lb)
tibetan_terrier.common_health_issues: Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Primary Lens Luxation (PLL), Hip Dysplasia, Distichiasis (extra eyelashes), Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis (neurological), Hypothyroidism, Diabetes Mellitus, Atopy (skin allergies).

toy_poodle.nature: Small, smart, and elegant. Lively and energetic, despite diminutive size. Highly sensitive; excels in training using positive reinforcement. Good for allergy sufferers.
toy_poodle.food_diet: High-quality, small-breed formula. **Monitor calories closely** (easy to overfeed a tiny dog). Use small meals/treats sparingly. **Puppies are prone to hypoglycemia**; feed small, frequent meals.
toy_poodle.health_care: Non-shedding, curly coat needs **daily brushing** or **professional grooming every 4–6 weeks**. Needs approx 40-60 minutes of exercise daily (walks/off-lead play). Use a **harness** to protect the delicate trachea. **Daily tooth brushing** is crucial (dental disease risk). Screen for eye and joint issues.
toy_poodle.size: Height: <= 25 cm (<= 10 in); Weight: 3–5 kg (6–10 lb)
toy_poodle.common_health_issues: Patellar luxation, Legg-Perthes Disease, Tracheal Collapse, Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), Addison's Disease, Von Willebrand's Disease (vWD), dental disease, ear infections.

toy_terrier.nature: Tiny, lively, and fearless. A true terrier in a toy's body (high prey drive). Alert, affectionate, and loyal. Suitable for less-mobile owners due to ability to self-exercise.
toy_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate food. **No special dietary requirements** but susceptible to obesity; strict portion control and moderate treats only. Feed two meals daily.
toy_terrier.health_care: Low maintenance; short coat needs minimal brushing. Needs **daily walks** and playtime. Use a harness. **Prone to chilling**; needs protection in cold weather. **Check for eye/joint issues** (patellar luxation, Legg-Calve-Perthes). Regular dental care is important.
toy_terrier.size: Height: 24–30 cm (10–12 in); Weight: <= 3.5 kg (<= 7.7 lb)
toy_terrier.common_health_issues: Patellar luxation, Legg-Calve-Perthes Disease, Juvenile Dilated Cardiomyopathy (hereditary heart condition), Von Willebrand's disease (vWD), eye conditions (glaucoma, cataracts), Demodectic Mange.

vizsla.nature: Affectionate, sensitive, and energetic Hungarian hunting dog ('Velcro dog'). Loves to stick close to owners. Needs a high level of physical and mental stimulation.
vizsla.food_diet: Complete, balanced dog food to keep them slim and healthy. Requires a diet supporting their **high energy** and lean build. Feed **twice daily**; leave a gap between eating and exercising (bloat prevention). Treats should not exceed 10% of calorie intake.
vizsla.health_care: Low maintenance grooming; short coat needs **weekly brushing**. **Needs a minimum of 2 hours of vigorous exercise daily** (running, swimming, agility). Does not have an undercoat and feels the cold easily; needs a jacket in winter. **Prone to separation anxiety**.
vizsla.size: Height: 53–64 cm (21–25 in); Weight: 20–30 kg (45–66 lb)
vizsla.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, Epilepsy, Entropion (eyelid), Autoimmune conditions (e.g., Sebaceous Adenitis, Polymyositis), certain cancers, bloat (GDV).

walker_hound.nature: Fast, alert, courageous, and friendly tracker. High-energy and very loyal. Can be very vocal (baying/howling) and has a high prey drive. Calm indoors if well-exercised.
walker_hound.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. Feed two measured meals daily. Monitor portions, as they are prone to obesity. Food-driven, which makes them highly trainable with treats.
walker_hound.health_care: Short, smooth coat needs minimal grooming. Needs **at least 1-2 hours of vigorous physical activity** daily (running, hiking). Their vocal nature can be problematic in apartments. Long, floppy ears need **weekly checks and cleaning**. Needs a **securely enclosed outdoor space** (high prey/roaming drive).
walker_hound.size: Height: 50–69 cm (20–27 in); Weight: 23–32 kg (50–70 lb)
walker_hound.common_health_issues: Hip Dysplasia, ear infections, eye problems (generally a healthy breed, but check for hereditary issues).

weimaraner.nature: Sleek, athletic, and loyal companion ('Gray Ghost'). High-energy and high-endurance. Prone to separation anxiety and destructive behavior if bored. Needs constant attention.
weimaraner.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. Deep-chested; high risk for **Bloat (GDV)**—feed multiple small meals daily, and restrict exercise around mealtimes. Prone to obesity.
weimaraner.health_care: Low grooming needs; brush weekly. Requires **at least an hour of vigorous daily exercise** (long runs, field work). Needs to be kept busy to prevent destructive behavior. **Daily dental care** is recommended. Screen for hip/elbow dysplasia and bloat.
weimaraner.size: Height: 58–69 cm (23–27 in); Weight: 25–40 kg (55–90 lb)
weimaraner.common_health_issues: Bloat (GDV), Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Panosteitis (growing bone pain in puppies), Distichiasis (extra eyelashes), dental disease, various cancers (Mast Cell Tumors).

welsh_springer_spaniel.nature: Cheerful, loving, and energetic. Highly intelligent and trainable. Can be over-excitable and prone to separation anxiety, digging, and alert barking.
welsh_springer_spaniel.food_diet: High-quality food fed **twice per day**. Food-motivated, so prone to weight gain/obesity; monitor portions and treats strictly.
welsh_springer_spaniel.health_care: Soft, feathered coat needs **regular brushing** and trimming. Long, floppy ears need regular checks/cleaning. Requires **high daily exercise** and mental stimulation (field work, agility). Screen for joint and eye issues.
welsh_springer_spaniel.size: Height: 43–48 cm (17–19 in); Weight: 16–25 kg (35–55 lb)
welsh_springer_spaniel.common_health_issues: Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, Autoimmune Thyroiditis (can lead to hypothyroidism), Glaucoma, Epilepsy, various eye issues.

west_highland_white_terrier.nature: Confident, spirited, affectionate, and lively. Tenacious earth dog bred for vermin control. Good family dog, but high prey drive means avoiding small pets (rabbits, gerbils).
west_highland_white_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. Maintaining a lean body condition is important. Diet changes may be needed to manage skin allergies (atopic dermatitis).
west_highland_white_terrier.health_care: Wiry double coat sheds minimally; requires **weekly brushing** and **hand stripping** a few times per year. Needs **daily exercise** (walks and play). Suitable for apartment life if exercised. Prone to separation anxiety. Screen for joint/skin issues.
west_highland_white_terrier.size: Height: 25–28 cm (10–11 in); Weight: 6.5–10 kg (14–22 lb)
west_highland_white_terrier.common_health_issues: Atopic Dermatitis (skin allergies—very common), **Westie Jaw** (Craniomandibular Osteopathy), Globoid Cell Leukodystrophy (neurological), Hip Dysplasia, Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD), Addison's Disease.

whippet.nature: Graceful, gentle, and quiet indoors. Athletic and fast (high-speed sighthound). Can be shy when meeting new people; needs early socialization. Prone to separation anxiety.
whippet.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet. Needs enough energy to sustain high-activity bursts. Feed twice daily. Maintaining a lean body mass is crucial.
whippet.health_care: Low grooming needs; weekly brush of the short coat. Needs **minimal daily exercise** (long walk/sniff session) plus **regular high-speed running** in a secure area. Sensitive skin (prone to cuts/scrapes). **Sighthound anesthesia sensitivity**.
whippet.size: Height: 44–51 cm (17.5–20 in); Weight: 11–18 kg (25–40 lb)
whippet.common_health_issues: Sighthound anesthesia sensitivity, Mitral Valve Disease (heart), Progressive Retinal Atrophy (PRA), immune-mediated problems, deafness.

wire-haired_fox_terrier.nature: Lively, bold, and intelligent hunter. Fearless and courageous. Highly trainable but can be aggressive with other dogs. Strong chase instinct.
wire-haired_fox_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, age-appropriate diet. Prone to obesity; monitor portions. Feed two meals daily.
wire-haired_fox_terrier.health_care: Wiry double coat needs **weekly brushing** and **regular stripping** (twice a year). Needs **daily vigorous exercise** and mental stimulation (agility, tricks). **Daily/frequent tooth brushing** is crucial (dental disease risk). Needs a secure fence/leash (strong chase instinct). Screen for joint/eye issues.
wire-haired_fox_terrier.size: Height: approx 39 cm (approx 15.5 in); Weight: 7–9.5 kg (15–21 lb)
wire-haired_fox_terrier.common_health_issues: Dental disease, atopic dermatitis (skin allergies), patellar luxation, Glaucoma, Hip and Elbow Dysplasia, neurological conditions (Wobbler Syndrome), certain cancers (Mast Cell Tumors).

yorkshire_terrier.nature: Tiny, brave, and glamorous with a big personality. Affectionate, bright, and playful. High-energy and very vocal (excellent watchdog). Can be difficult to housebreak.
yorkshire_terrier.food_diet: High-quality, balanced diet formulated for **toy breeds** (small kibble size ideal). Prone to obesity; portion control is vital. Puppies need frequent, small meals to prevent hypoglycemia. Food should support silky coat.
yorkshire_terrier.health_care: High grooming needs; long, silky coat needs **daily brushing/trimming**. Needs daily exercise (walks/play). Use a **harness** to protect the delicate trachea. **Daily tooth brushing** is mandatory (very high dental disease risk). Screen for eye/joint issues.
yorkshire_terrier.size: Height: 18–20 cm (7–8 in); Weight: <= 3.2 kg (<= 7 lb)
yorkshire_terrier.common_health_issues: Patellar luxation, Collapsed Trachea, dental disease, Portosystemic Shunt (PSS—liver), eye problems (cataracts, PRA), Intervertebral Disc Disease (IVDD), heart disease, Hypoglycemia (in puppies).
